item.title: By: Nigel Ainscoe
item.dc:creator: Nigel Ainscoe
item.description:
Yes this test flagged a procedure that used SET NUMERIC_ROUNDABORT OFF, no variables in it at all!
This test is effectively useless and should be re-written or removed. Given that it is now effectively integrated with tSQLt and RedGate SQL Test it is going to confuse a lot of people.

item.title: By: Koenraad Dendievel
item.dc:creator: Koenraad Dendievel
item.content:encoded:
Select TOP 100 PERCENT Name
From sys.sysobjects
Where XType = ‘P’
And (Object_Definition(ID) Like N’%decimal[^(^”^[ ]^[[]%’
Or Object_Definition(ID) Like ‘%numeric[^(^”^[ ]^[[]]%’)
And ObjectProperty(ID, N’IsMSShipped’) = 0
Order By Name

item.title: By: Antman
item.dc:creator: Antman
item.content:encoded:
I consider this neither fast nor pretty, but it works with n/varchar(max) definitions in our DB, leaving me with about 928 things that look mostly like cast() and convert() code blocks to examine after a short time…

;with StoredProcedures ([Name], [Definition]) as (
select [Name],
[Definition] = object_definition(id)
from sys.sysobjects
where xtype = ‘P’
and ObjectProperty(id, N’IsMSShipped’) = 0
and object_definition(id) like ‘%varchar%’
), DefinitionSegments ([Name], [Index]) as (
select [Name], [Index] = charindex(‘varchar’, [Definition], 1)
from StoredProcedures
where charindex(‘varchar’, [Definition], 1) > 0
union all
select DefinitionSegments.[Name], [Index] = charindex(‘varchar’, [Definition], DefinitionSegments.[Index]+1)
from StoredProcedures
join DefinitionSegments on DefinitionSegments.[Name]=StoredProcedures.[Name]
where charindex(‘varchar’, [Definition], DefinitionSegments.[Index]+1) > 0
)
select DefinitionSegments.[Name],
[DefinitionSegment] = substring([Definition], [Index] – 20, 50)
from StoredProcedures
join DefinitionSegments on DefinitionSegments.[Name]=StoredProcedures.[Name]
where substring([Definition], [Index], 12) != ‘varchar(max)’
and substring([Definition], [Index], 13) != ‘varchar (max)’
and substring([Definition], [Index], 9) not like ‘varchar([0-9]%’
and substring([Definition], [Index], 10) not like ‘varchar ([0-9]%’
order by DefinitionSegments.[Name], [Index]

item.title: By: Geoff Lloyd
item.dc:creator: Geoff Lloyd
item.description: The test here uses a text compare in the definition to determine whether any text in the procedure has a 'decimal' or 'numeric' without something like (9,2) defined immediately after it. However it does not cater for a definition such as 'decimal (9,2)'. A procedure will also be picked up by this test if you happen to have the word 'decimal' or 'numeric' in a comment within the definition.
